properties.title: Usage tour: Managing users and groups

section.name: Managing users and groups
section.p:
The HippoECM security model is build around 4 concepts, users, groups, roles and domains. Users with administrative rights can switch to the management perspective to do CRUD operations on these entities.
User: representation of an end-user that can log in to the CMS. Users are member(s) of 0-n groups
Group: logical categorization of users. Groups have 0-n users as members.
Role: collection of permissions read, write and remove. Either can be true or false.
Domain: collection of 'Auth roles' and 'Domain rules'.
Auth role: Maps a role to 0-n groups and/or users
Domain rules: todo

subsection.name: Creating a new user
subsection.p:
Click on the 'New user' button (listing 1) in the left pane of the management perspective. A text input field will appear where you can type the new user's username (listing 2). Press enter to create the new user instance and load the edit user form.
The new user will appear in the users list (left pane) with an asterisk marking it as new (listing 3).

td.em: Click on the 'New user' button to add a user
Type in the new username and press enter to confirm
The new user will appear in the list, marked with an asterisk

subsection.p:
The new user is automatically selected which will load the edit-user-form in the middle pane. Above this form two buttons will appear, "ok" and "cancel". Pressing "ok" on a *new* user will persist it in the repository and the asterisk will disappear. Clicking "cancel" on a *new* user will remove it completly.
Clicking "ok" or "cancel" on an existing user will either save all pending changes, or simply unload the edit-form again.
Only after a user has been persisted for the first time, you will be able to configure it as a member of one or more groups. You can do this by dragging a group from the groups list (left pane) into the list beneath the users form.

subsection.name: Creating a new group
subsection.p:
Click on the 'New group' button (listing 4) in the left pane of the management perspective. A text input field will appear where you can type the new group's name (listing 5). Press enter to create the new group instance and load the edit group form.
The new group will appear in the groups list (left pane) with an asterisk marking it as new (listing 3).

td.em: Click on the 'New group' button to add a group
Type in the new group name and press enter to confirm
The new group will appear in the list, marked with an asterisk

subsection.p:
The new group is automatically selected which will load the edit-group-form in the middle pane. Above this form two buttons will appear, "ok" and "cancel". Pressing "ok" on a *new* group will persist it in the repository and the asterisk will disappear. Clicking "cancel" on a *new* group will remove it completly.
Clicking "ok" or "cancel" on an existing group will either save all pending changes, or simply unload the edit-form again.
Only after a group has been persisted for the first time, you will be able to configure it's user-members. You can do this by dragging a user from the users list (left pane) into the list beneath the edit-group-form.
